description: What's Happening cards - normalize experiences without overpromising

cards.title: The Yawns
cards.headline: You're yawning a lot and it feels strange
cards.tryThis: Let it happen. Don't suppress. Each yawn is your nervous system recalibrating.
cards.whyItWorks: Yawning is a serotonergic response, not tiredness. Psilocybin activates 5-HT2A receptors, which trigger this cascade. It's a sign the medicine is working, not that you're tired.
cards.normalcy: This happens to most people. It typically peaks in the first 30-60 minutes and subsides.

cards.title: The Emotional Wave
cards.headline: Unexpected emotions are surfacing
cards.tryThis: Don't resist. Find a comfortable position. Let the wave pass through you. It will pass.
cards.whyItWorks: Microdoses lower the default mode network's grip, allowing suppressed material to surface. This is integration, not breakdown.
cards.normalcy: Emotional release is common and often therapeutic. These waves typically last 5-20 minutes.

cards.title: Body Load
cards.headline: Your body feels heavy or strange
cards.tryThis: Move gently. Stretch. Walk. Don't fight the sensation — work with it.
cards.whyItWorks: Psilocybin affects the gut (5-HT2A receptors are throughout the digestive system). Light movement helps the body process.
cards.normalcy: Body load is dose-dependent and varies by person. It usually peaks at 45-90 minutes and fades.

cards.title: Everything Is Loud
cards.headline: Sounds, colors, or sensations feel amplified
cards.tryThis: Lean into it. Put on music you love. Look at something beautiful. This is enhanced perception, not overwhelm.
cards.whyItWorks: Psychedelics increase sensory gating, meaning more information reaches conscious awareness. Your filters are thinner today.
cards.normalcy: Heightened senses are a feature, not a bug. Use it for creative work or appreciation.

cards.title: Nothing Is Happening
cards.headline: You don't feel anything different
cards.tryThis: Wait. Don't redose. The effects may be subtle. Check in tonight — you might notice the difference in retrospect.
cards.whyItWorks: Threshold doses work below conscious perception. The changes happen in how you respond to your day, not in how you feel right now.
cards.normalcy: Sub-perceptual is the goal. 'Feeling it' often means you're above threshold. Give it time.

cards.title: The Anxiety Spike
cards.headline: You're feeling more anxious than usual
cards.tryThis: This is almost always temporary. Ground yourself (feet on floor, 5-4-3-2-1). Consider: is this new anxiety, or anxiety you were already carrying that's now visible?
cards.whyItWorks: Psychedelics amplify what's already present. Anxiety on a dose day often reveals existing tension, not new problems.
cards.normalcy: Some anxiety can occur, especially early in practice. It usually diminishes with familiarity and proper set/setting.

cards.title: The Flow State
cards.headline: You're unusually focused and creative
cards.tryThis: Don't question it. Ride it. Capture ideas. This is the dose working as intended for creativity.
cards.whyItWorks: Reduced default mode network activity + increased neural connectivity = novel associations and sustained attention.
cards.normalcy: Flow states are common, especially for creativity-oriented intentions. They typically last 2-4 hours.

cards.title: The Afterglow
cards.headline: You feel lighter the day after
cards.tryThis: Notice it. Write it down. This is data about what's possible for you.
cards.whyItWorks: Neuroplasticity effects continue after the acute experience. BDNF (brain-derived neurotrophic factor) remains elevated.
cards.normalcy: The afterglow is real and measurable. It's often where the real benefit lives.

cards.title: The Energy Shift
cards.headline: Your energy is different than expected
cards.tryThis: Follow your body. If it wants rest, rest. If it wants movement, move. Don't fight the direction.
cards.whyItWorks: Energy modulation is individual. Some people feel activated, others feel restorative. Both are valid responses.
cards.normalcy: There's no 'right' energy response. Track your patterns across doses to understand your typical response.

cards.title: Social Sensitivity
cards.headline: Other people feel more intense
cards.tryThis: Be selective about who you're around. This is a day for real conversations, not small talk. Or: enjoy solitude.
cards.whyItWorks: Reduced ego defenses mean more emotional permeability. You're picking up more social information than usual.
cards.normalcy: Many people prefer solitude or selective company on dose days. Plan accordingly.

cards.title: The Comedown
cards.headline: The effects are fading and you feel off
cards.tryThis: Eat something. Drink water. Rest if possible. This transition is normal and temporary.
cards.whyItWorks: Serotonin modulation takes energy. Your brain is returning to baseline. Support it with nutrition and rest.
cards.normalcy: A gentle comedown is normal. If it's harsh, consider your sleep, hydration, and food timing.

cards.title: Diminished Effects
cards.headline: The dose feels weaker than before
cards.tryThis: Check your carryover. If you've dosed recently, tolerance is real. Don't increase — wait. Let your system reset.
cards.whyItWorks: 5-HT2A receptor downregulation happens quickly. Dosing too frequently reduces sensitivity. The solution is rest, not more.
cards.normalcy: This is your cue to take a break. 2-3 days minimum between doses for most people.
